properties.descriptions: Hundreds hurl stones at officers in Jerusalem after Friday prayers at al-Aqsa Mosque while protesters rallied against anti-Islam film,
properties.author: Oz Rosenberg

properties.descriptions: About 1,000 Bangladeshi Islamists tried to march on the U.S. embassy in Dhaka on Thursday to protest against a U.S. film that is said to insult the Prophet Mohammad but security forces stopped them reaching the mission,
properties.author: Press

properties.descriptions: In Sanaa, Yemen, the U.S. Embassy was overrun Thursday by protesters who stormed a wall, set fire to a building inside the compound, broke windows and carried away office supplies and other souvenirs before being dispersed by local security forces,
properties.author: Karen DeYoung

properties.descriptions: In Cairo, clouds of tear gas floated through the fortified area around the U.S. Embassy as security forces clashed with protesters for the third straight day,
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: "The US dispatched an elite group of Marines to Tripoli on Wednesday after the mob attack that killed the US ambassador and three other Americans," "Officials were investigating whether the rampage was a backlash to an anti-Islamic video with ties to Coptic Christians or a plot to coincide with the anniversary of 9/11."
properties.author: Osama Alfitory

properties.descriptions: Palestinians on Friday protested an anti-Muslim film, with thousands gathering in the Gaza Strip and hundreds in Jerusalem where there were clashes with Israeli police,
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: In Indonesia, the world's most populous Muslim nation, about 200 protesters in Jakarta chanted slogans and held up signs in a largely peaceful protest outside the heavily guarded U.S. Embassy,
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: "Britain's Foreign Office says police in Sudan are confronting a protest outside the British embassy in Khartoum," "Protesters pull down emblem at German embassy in Sudan, raise Islamic flag."
properties.author: Matthew Weaver

properties.descriptions: Thousands of angry Kashmiri Muslims protested Friday against an anti-Islam film, burning U.S. flags and calling President Barack Obama a 'terrorist,' while the top government cleric here reportedly demanded Americans leave the volatile Indian-controlled region immediately, reports the AP. "At least 15,000 people took part in more than two dozen protests across Kashmir, chanting 'Down with America' and 'Down with Israel' in some of the largest anti-American demonstrations against the film in Asia."
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: Hundreds of protesters set alight a Kentucky Fried Chicken restaurant in the northern Lebanese city of Tripoli on Friday, witnesses said, chanting against the pope's visit to Lebanon and shouting anti-American slogans,
properties.author: Reuters

properties.descriptions: "Ansar al Sharia supporters protesting in front of Tibesty Hotel in Benghazi, carrying black flags"
In Tehran, students gathered Thursday outside the Swiss Embassy, which represents U.S. interests in Iran, to protest the video,
properties.author: Hakim Almasmari

properties.descriptions: In Iraq, reaction to the video clip has been limited to followers of Shiite groups linked to militias and neighboring Iran, reports The Wall Street Journal. "Several hundred followers of anti-American cleric Moqtada al-Sadr held brief demonstrations in Baghdad's Sadr City district, the southern oil city of Basra and other predominantly Shiite areas of the country, chanting 'Death to America.'"
properties.author: Hakim Almasmari

properties.descriptions: Around 400 protesters rallied in front of Islamabad's Laal Masjid after Friday prayers.
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: Jamaat-e-Islami (JI) organised a rally in Karachi, where around 700 party activists and supporters gathered with banners and placards bearing anti-US and anti-Israel slogans.
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: Around 10,000 people participated in the main rally organised on The Mall by the Tehreek Hurmat-i-Rasool (THR) where they burned US flags and an effigy in front of the American consulate.
properties.author: Rana Tanveer

properties.descriptions: Protesters threw shoes at US and Israeli flags and set them on fire during a rally organized by Jamiat Talba Arbia and Shehri Mahaz.
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: "Hundreds of Afghans  some shouting "Death to America"  burned the U.S. flag and an effigy of President Barack Obama on Friday during a protest against an anti-Islam film outside the eastern city of Jalalabad."
properties.author: Amir Shah

properties.descriptions: Thousands of Somali protesters have taken to the streets of capital Mogadishu to express their anger over the anti-Islam movie produced by an Israeli-American in the United States,
properties.author: STAFF

properties.descriptions: Protesters in Tunisia have set fire to an American school in the capital Tunis, according to Reuters. The New York Post reports that "Anti-American rioting spread yesterday to Tunisia, where police used tear gas to stop hundreds of protesters from storming the United States Embassy in protest over a film mocking the prophet Mohammed."
properties.author: STAFF

properties.descriptions: In Algeria, APS journalist witnessed about 60 people demonstrated peacefully on Friday in the town of Kouba to denounce the film,"reports the Algerian Press Service. "Gathered after Friday prayers, protesters chanted slogans praising Islam and Prophet Muhammad, rejecting Islamophobia and insults to religious symbols.
properties.author: STAFF

properties.descriptions: Roughly 150 protesters marched on the US embassy in London chanting burn burn USA as the American flag went up in flames, soon joined by the Israeli flag.
properties.author: Neal Sears

properties.descriptions: About 500 demonstrators gathered yesterday near the US embassy in Kuwait waving a black Al-Qaeda flag in protest of a film mocking Islam," reports AFP. "President Barack 'Obama, we are all Osama,' they chanted referring to Al-Qaeda's former leader Osama bin Laden who was killed by US forces last year, an AFP photographer at the site of the demonstration reported."
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: "Protesters in southern India have been arrested for throwing rocks at the U.S. Consulate in Chennai, the city police commissioner said,"reports CNN. "As many as 200 protesters were demonstrating in front of the building, but the number arrested was not reported. There were no reported injuries."
properties.author: STAFF

properties.descriptions: A demonstration by about 50 Muslims, some of whom carried banners and flags gathered close to the US Consulate in Amsterdam, where they protested about the American film, Innocence of Muslims.
properties.author: STAFF

properties.descriptions: Roughly 100 to 400 people gathered outside the United Nations (UN) building in Male, Maldives over an anti-Islam film.
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: Sri Lankan Muslims have burnt effigies of President Obama and American flags at a protest demanding the US ban the film Innocence of Muslims near the U.S Embassy in the capital Colombo
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: Hundreds of worshippers marched near the US embassy in Qatar on Friday over the anti-Islam video
properties.author: STAFF

properties.descriptions: Nigerian troops fired into the air on Friday to disperse Muslims protesting in the city of Jos against an American film about the Prophet Mohammad
properties.author: STAFF

properties.descriptions: Reporting from Egypt, Al Jazeera's Rawya Rageh said protesters belonging to ultra-conservative groups in Sinai stormed a camp for the UN multinational peacekeepers in Sheikh Zuwayed town. They brought down the flag and placed a black banner with the words "There's no God but Allah, Muhammad is the Prophet of Allah."
Hundreds of Salafists burned US flags after weekly prayers at a mosque in Sale, Morocco
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: In Morocco's largest city Casablanca, between 300 and 400 Muslim activists gathered outside the US consulate, amid a heavy police presence, some shouting anti-US slogans, including "Death to Obama!
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: Hundreds of protesters gathered in front of the U.S. embassy in Damascus to protest the American Film
More than 2,000 Jordanians took to the streets to protest the movie. The protesters burned a US flag in front of the Kurdi Mosque near the USA embassy in Amman.
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: Mauritanian youths gathered in front of the American embassy in Nouakchott, where they chanted slogans condemning the offensive film
Malaysian Muslims shout slogans as they marched to the U.S during a protest in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: A crowd held a demonstration at the Batu Caves, a popular tourist spot outside the capital
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: Malaysian media reported a protest in the northern city of Ipoh
properties.author: AFP

properties.descriptions: A peaceful protest was held here Friday against a blasphemous anti-Islam American movie. Protestors set afire an effigy symbolizing the US in the old city of Hyderabad
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: More than 2,000 protesters chanted against the film and burned American and Israeli flags after Friday prayers in Diraz, outside the capital, Manama
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: Hundreds of people gathered in Istanbul's Beyazit Square to protest the prophet film The protest was organized by Turkey's main Islamist political party, Saadet."
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: In the city of Nablus, about 200 people demonstrated against the film as Muslim clerics throughout the territory preached against it in Friday sermons
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: In the southern city of Basra, about 1,000 took to the streets and burned the American and Israeli flags. One banner said: 'Freedom doesn't mean offending two billion Muslims
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: A group of Kenyan Muslims burn[ed] the US flag in protest over the anti-Muslim film that has spawned mob violence against American embassies across the Mideast, following afternoon prayers outside the Sakina Jamia Mosque in the port city of Mombasa, Kenya
properties.author: Aya Batrawy and Lee Keath

properties.descriptions: A Kashmiri Muslim with his face covered burn[ed] a mock American flag as others shout slogans during a protest Friday in Srinagar, India
properties.author: Paige Kollock

properties.descriptions: Iraqi supporters of Shiite cleric Moqtada al-Sadr's movement, burn[ed] the Israeli and the US flags during a protest denouncing a film deemed offensive to Islam, on September 13, 2012 in the central Iraqi city of Kut
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: Arab-Israeli Muslim men protest against a film mocking Islam, in front of the U.S. embassy in the Mediterranean coastal city of Tel Aviv, on September 13, 2012
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: Afghans burn the U.S. flag in the Ghanikhel district of Nangarhar province, east of Kabul, Afghanistan, on September 14, 2012, during a protest against an anti-Islam film
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: The AP captured photographs of an anti-film protest in the Palestinian refugee camp of Ain el-Hilweh near Sidon, Lebanon.
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: Roughly 200 Muslims marched from Sydney's Town Hall to Martin Place yesterday afternoon before confronting police outside the US consulate," Some protesters allegedly threw glass bottles and other missiles at police, forcing officers to use capsicum spray during the violence that led to six police and 17 others being injured."
properties.author: Lanai Vasek

properties.descriptions: In the far northern city of Sokoto, on the threshold of the Sahara desert, thousands of people marched peacefully carrying placards reading 'Down with America' and 'We love our Prophet', under a light security presence,
properties.author: Reuters

properties.descriptions: More than 2,500 people have poured into the streets of Kabul, where they burned tires and a car, and attacked police and a US base with stones.
properties.author: Emma Graham-Harrison

properties.descriptions: Afghan insurgents ... staged a daring, well-planned raid on Camp Bastion, the military base where Britain's Prince Harry is deployed. "The Taliban said it carried out the strike, calling it a response to the anti-Islam film stoking anger among Muslims.
200 Muslim protesters gathered in the city center of Antwerp on Sunday, protesting against the US-made film 'The Innocence of Muslims,
properties.author: Anne Sewell

properties.descriptions: Hundreds of people protested on Saturday outside the U.S. Embassy in Paris, denouncing a film produced in the United States that insults the Prophet Muhammad
properties.author: AP

properties.descriptions: Fourteen people were killed in the port city of Karach on Friday after confrontations with Pakistani authorities
properties.author: BBC, Aleem Maqbool

properties.descriptions:
Five protestors died in the north-western city of Peshawar on Friday after ransacking cinemas and a confrontation with Pakistani authorities	34.004299	71.54483	http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-19678412	9/21/2012	Aleem Maqbool											
9/21/2012	Kuala Lumpur	Malaysia	A peaceful protest took place outside the US embassy in the Malaysian capital, Kuala Lumpur"
properties.author: Aleem Maqbool

properties.descriptions: "3,000 people marched in the southern Iraqi city of Basra"
properties.author: Aleem Maqbool

properties.descriptions: Thousands burned US and French flags in the Bangladeshi capital, Dhaka
properties.author: Aleem Maqbool

properties.descriptions: Crowds rallied in Baalbek in Lebanon in a protest organised by the Shia militant group, Hezbollah, burning US and Israeli flags
properties.author: Aleem Maqbool

properties.descriptions: Thousands of Libyans joined a march in Benghazi against Islamist militia who have been blamed for an attack in which the US ambassador and three other American officials were killed
properties.author: Aleem Maqbool

properties.descriptions: In the capital, Islamabad, which saw its first clashes between protesters and security forces on Thursday, a police checkpoint was burnt as demonstrators tried to breach the red zone" where the main embassies and government offices are based."
properties.author: Aleem Maqbool

properties.descriptions: Police fired tear gas and live ammunition to push back the tens of thousands of protesters they faced in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad, and the major cities of Lahore, Karachi and Peshawar. They were successful in preventing the protesters from reaching U.S. diplomatic offices in the cities, even though the demonstrators streamed over shipping containers set up on major roads to block their path.
properties.author: Fox News
